com.github.methylene.sym

Class Permutation

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.methylene.sym.Permutation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable<Permutation>

    public final class Permutation
extends Object
implements Comparable<Permutation>
    An ranking based permutation operation that can be used to shuffle arrays and lists. Instances of this class are immutable, and none of the apply methods modify the input. The toCycles method can be used to obtain the destructive version of an instance.
    See Also:
    toCycles()

    • Method Detail

      • define

        public static Permutation define(int... ranking)
        Return the permutation defined by the given array.
        Parameters:
        ranking - a list of numbers that specifies the permutation in zero-based one-line notation. For example, define(1, 2, 0) creates the permutation that maps "abc" to "cab".
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the input is not a ranking

      • defineCycle

        public static Permutation defineCycle(int... cycle)
        Creates a new cycle. A single number n creates the identity of length n + 1. An emtpy input produces the permutation of length 0.
        Parameters:
        cycle - a list of distinct, non-negative numbers
        Returns:
        the cyclic permutation defined by cycle
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if cycle contains negative numbers or duplicates

      • cycle1

        public static Permutation cycle1(int... cycle1based)
        Creates a new cycle.
        Parameters:
        cycle1based - a list of numbers that defines a permutation in 1-based cycle notation
        Returns:
        the cyclic permutation defined by cycle1based
        See Also:
        defineCycle(int...)

      • random

        public static Permutation random(int length)
        Creates a random permutation of given length.
        Parameters:
        length - the length of arrays that the result can be applied to
        Returns:
        a random permutation that can be applied to an array of length length

      • identity

        public static Permutation identity()
        Return the identity permutation. It is the only permutation that can be applied to arrays of any length.
        Returns:
        the identity permutation that can be applied to an array of length length
        See Also:
        isIdentity()

      • compose

        public Permutation compose(Permutation other)

        Permutation composition. The following is true for all non-negative numbers i:

        
   this.apply(other.apply(i)) == this.compose(other).apply(i)
        Parameters:
        other - a permutation
        Returns:
        the product of this instance and other
        See Also:
        product(com.github.methylene.sym.Permutation...)

      • product

        public static Permutation product(Permutation... permutations)
        Take the product of the given permutations.
        Parameters:
        permutations - an array of permutations
        Returns:
        the product of the input
        See Also:
        compose(com.github.methylene.sym.Permutation)

      • product

        public static Permutation product(Iterable<Permutation> permutations)
        Take the product of the given permutations. If the input is empty, a permutation of length 0 is returned.
        Parameters:
        permutations - an iterable of permutations
        Returns:
        the product of the input
        See Also:
        compose(com.github.methylene.sym.Permutation)

      • pow

        public Permutation pow(int n)
        Raise this permutation to the nth power. If n is positive, the product 
        
   this.compose(this)[...]compose(this)
        (n times) is returned. If n is negative, the product 
        
   this.invert().compose(this.invert()) [...] compose(this.invert());
        (-n times) is returned. If n is zero, the identity permutation of length this.length is returned.
        Parameters:
        n - any integer
        Returns:
        the nth power of this permutation

      • invert

        public Permutation invert()

        Inverts this permutation. The following always returns true:

        
   this.compose(this.inverse).isIdentity();
        Returns:
        the inverse of this permutation
        See Also:
        compose(com.github.methylene.sym.Permutation), isIdentity()

      • move

        public static Permutation move(int delete,
                               int insert)
        Creates a cycle that acts as a delete followed by an insert. Examples: 
        
   Permutation.move(0, 2).apply("12345");
   => 23145
   
        
   Permutation.move(3, 1).apply("12345");
   => 14235
        If delete == insert, the identity of length delete + 1 is returned.
        Parameters:
        delete - a non-negative integer
        insert - a non-negative integer
        Returns:
        a permutation of length Math.max(delete, insert) + 1
        See Also:
        defineCycle(int...)

      • orbit

        public int[] orbit(int i)

        Calculate the orbit of given index. The orbit is an array of distinct integers that contains all indexes

        
   i, apply(i), apply(apply(i)), ...

        The orbit always contains at least one element, that is the start index i itself.

        Parameters:
        i - a non negative number which is less than this.length()
        Returns:
        the orbit of i
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if i < 0 or i >= this.length.

      • order

        public int order()

        Calculate the order of this permutation. The order is the smallest positive number n such that

        
   this.pow(n).isIdentity();
        Returns:
        the order of this permutation
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if pos < 0 or pos >= this.length
        See Also:
        isIdentity(), pow(int)

      • isCycle

        public boolean isCycle()

        Determine whether this permutation has at most one than one nontrivial orbit.

        Returns:
        true if this permutation is a cycle
        See Also:
        defineCycle(int...), orbit(int)

      • toCycles

        public Cycles toCycles()
        Get a cycle based version of this operation, which can be used to change arrays in place.
        Returns:
        a cycle based version of this operation

      • reverse

        public static Permutation reverse(int length)

        Returns a permutation that reverses its input. Example:

        
   Permutation.reverse(5).apply("12345");
   => 54321
        Parameters:
        length - a non negative number
        Returns:
        a permutation that reverses an array of length length

      • reverses

        public boolean reverses(int n)
        Check if this permutation reverses its input.
        Parameters:
        n - a nonnegative number
        Returns:
        true if this permutation reverses or "flips" an input of length n
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if n is negative
        See Also:
        reverse(int)

      • shift

        public Permutation shift(int n)
        Returns a shifted permutation. The following is true for the shifted permutation: 
        
   p.shift(n).apply(j) = j, j < n
   p.shift(n).apply(n + i) = n + p.apply(i)
        Parameters:
        n - a non negative number
        Returns:
        the shifted permutation
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if n is negative

      • findCycle

        public int[] findCycle()
        Find a cycle in this permutation or return null if this is the identity.
        Returns:
        a cycle in this permutation or null if there are no cycles because this is the identity

      • isIdentity

        public boolean isIdentity()

        Determine whether this permutation moves any index.

        Returns:
        true if this is the identity

      • length

        public int length()
        Return the minimum number of elements that an array or list must have, in order for this operation to be applicable.
        Returns:
        the length of this operation

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Convert this permutation to a human readable string. This representation may change in the future.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        a String representation of this permutation.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object other)
        Equality test. In order for permutations to be equal, they must have the same length, and their effects on indexes and arrays must be identical.
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object
        Parameters:
        other - another object
        Returns:
        true if the other object is an equivalent permutation

        public int hashCode()
        Overrides:

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Permutation other)
        A compare method compatible with equals: permutations compare to 0 if and only they are equal.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface Comparable<Permutation>
        Parameters:
        other - a permutation, not necessarily of the same length
        Returns:
        the result of lexicographic comparison of this.ranking and other.ranking
        See Also:
        equals(java.lang.Object)

      • getRanking

        public int[] getRanking()
        Get a copy of the ranking that represents of this permutation.
        Returns:
        a copy of the ranking

      • apply

        public int apply(int i)
        Move an index. The following is true for arrays a of any type and of length a.length >= this.length, and all indexes 0 <= i < a.length: 
           apply(a)[apply(i)] == a[i];
        If the input is greater than or equal to this.length(), then the same number is returned.
        Parameters:
        i - a non negative number
        Returns:
        the moved index
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the input is negative

      • apply

        public <T> T[] apply(T[] input)
        Rearrange an array. This method does not modify its input array.
        Parameters:
        input - an array of length not less than this.length()
        Returns:
        the result of applying this permutation to input
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if input.length < this.length()
        See Also:
        apply(int), toCycles(), Cycles.apply(Object[])

        public <E> List<E> apply(List<E> input)

        Returns:

        Throws:

      • from

        public static Permutation from(int[] a,
                               int[] b)
        Returns a permutation that rearranges a into b.
        Parameters:
        a - an array
        b - an array that can be obtained by changing the order of the elements of a
        Returns:
        a permutation so that Arrays.equals(Permutation.from(a, b).apply(a), b) is true
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if b is not a rearrangement of a.
